channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: ABC News Drops Correspondent Terry Moran Over Social Media Post
item.description: Walt Disney Co.’s ABC News division said it parted ways with Washington-based correspondent Terry Moran over comments he made on social media about White House Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller.
item.dc:creator: Chris Palmeri

media:content.media:description: Terry Moran

item.title: Zuckerberg Recruits for New Meta AGI Group | Bloomberg Tech 6/10/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Meta’s plans for a new ‘Superintelligence’ AI group. Plus, Apple expands its deal with OpenAI. And the CEO of United Launch Alliance says NASA has alternatives to Elon Musk’s SpaceX. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: EchoStar Bondholders Huddle With Law Firm Akin Gump as Default Looms
item.description: Bondholders to EchoStar Corp. are working with law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld and investment bank Centerview Partners LLC as the telecommunications company mulls a potential bankruptcy filing amid a Federal Communications Commission probe, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Reshmi Basu, Eliza Ronalds-Hannon

media:content.media:description: A Dish satellite dish receiver at a home in Wrightwood, California.

item.title: Amazon Security Chief Urges Hands-Off Approach to AI Regulation
item.description: Amazon.com Inc.’s chief security officer joined officials at other major tech companies in calling for fewer regulations in artificial intelligence, warning that government involvement in this rapidly emerging area risks narrowing the scope of the company’s work.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Tarabay

media:content.media:description: An Amazon Web Services data center in Stone Ridge, Virginia, US, on Sunday, July 28, 2024. Data center developers in Northern Virginia are asking utility Dominion Energy Inc. for as much power as several nuclear reactors can generate, in the latest sign of how artificial intelligence is helping drive up electricity demand.

item.title: Zuckerberg Is Personally Recruiting New ‘Superintelligence’ AI Team at Meta
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg, frustrated with Meta Platforms Inc.’s shortfalls in AI, is assembling a team of experts to achieve artificial general intelligence, recruiting from a brain trust of AI researchers and engineers who’ve met with him in recent weeks at his homes in Lake Tahoe and Palo Alto.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner, Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Meta’s Threads Testing New Private Messaging Feature
item.description: Threads, the Meta Platforms Inc. social network that rivals Elon Musk’s X, is testing a new messaging feature for users to interact privately on the service.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: The Threads application.

item.title: Whole Foods Supplier Hack Leaves Empty Shelves, Stalls Forklifts
item.description: United Natural Foods Inc., a grocery distributor for Amazon Inc.’s Whole Foods Market, is working to bring systems back online by June 15 and resume product deliveries after a cyberattack disrupted its operations, leaving some store shelves barren of ice cream, bread and other goods.
item.dc:creator: Cameron Fozi, Margi Murphy, Jake Bleiberg

media:content.media:description: A worker stocks shelves in a Whole Foods Market location in New York.

item.title: How Fintech Founder Rejected Stripe Buyout Before Building $775 Million Fortune
item.description: Seven years ago, Airwallex co-founder Jack Zhang walked away from what looked like the deal of a lifetime. Stripe Inc. was offering to buy his firm for $1.2 billion and legendary Sequoia investor Michael Moritz was urging him to accept.
item.dc:creator: Emily Mason

media:content.media:description: Jack Zhang Source: Airwallex

item.title: Publicis Wins $1.7 Billion Mars Advertising Account from WPP
item.description: Publicis Groupe SA has won a major new client, snagging the $1.7 billion ad portfolio for M&Ms and Snickers owner Mars Inc. from WPP Plc, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Berthelot, Will Kubzansky

media:content.media:description: Mars Inc's M&Ms candy at a store in the Harlem neighborhood of New York, US, on Wednesday, Aug. 14, 2024. Mars Inc. agreed to buy Kellanova for nearly $36 billion including debt, bringing together two major food companies in the biggest deal of the year.

item.title: Data Centers Prompt US to Boost Power-Usage Forecast by 92%
item.description: US data centers are rapidly driving up demand for power, with the official forecast for electricity consumption next year almost doubling in the past month.
item.dc:creator: Will Wade

media:content.media:description: An Amazon Web Services data center in Ashburn, Virginia, US, on Sunday, July 28, 2024. Data center developers in Northern Virginia are asking utility Dominion Energy Inc. for as much power as several nuclear reactors can generate, in the latest sign of how artificial intelligence is helping drive up electricity demand.

item.title: Musk’s Banker Michael Grimes Sells SpaceX, Anduril for Trump Job
item.description: Michael Grimes, the veteran technology investment banker who helped Elon Musk buy Twitter in 2022, reported assets worth as much as $98 million in a financial disclosure as part of his new role at the Commerce Department.
item.dc:creator: Bill Allison, Sophie Alexander

media:content.media:description: Michael Grimes

item.title: Snap’s First Consumer AR ‘Specs’ Glasses Will Arrive in 2026
item.description: Snap Inc. plans to launch its first consumer pair of augmented-reality glasses next year, beating a planned release from rival Meta Platforms Inc. by several months.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Kelly, Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Snap Inc Evan Spiegel wears the Spectacle Augmented Reality glasses in Paris on May 19.

item.title: Qualcomm Demonstrates New Processor for AI-Based Smart Glasses
item.description: Qualcomm Inc., the top maker of smartphone processors, is making a bigger push into smart glasses with low-power components that can run artificial intelligence software.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Qualcomm headquarters in San Diego, California.

item.title: Sonos Upgrades Ace Headphones as Part of Software Turnaround
item.description: Sonos Inc. released a major software update for its Ace wireless headphones on Tuesday, as it works to rebuild its reputation following a disastrous app overhaul last year.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Sonos Ace headphones during a media preview in New York, US, on Wednesday, May 15, 2024. Sonos Inc. is entering the headphone market with a $449 device, part of an effort to turn the home-speaker company into a broader maker of consumer technology.

item.title: Academic Publishers Sign AI Deals as US Cuts Research Grants
item.description: Academic publishers are rushing to sign licensing deals with artificial intelligence companies, carving out a new revenue stream as US research funding cuts dim their outlook.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Meley

item.title: Retail Stock Investors Can Now Imitate the Pros With AI Trading Tools
item.description: Artificial intelligence trading tools that analyze reams of data and build portfolios are already shaking up Wall Street. But as they increasingly become available to retail investors, the entire stock market is in for a seismic transformation.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Kniazhevich

media:content.media:description: David Lin Source: Linvest21 Inc.

item.title: CoreWeave and Palantir Get Meme Stock Comparisons as Shares Soar
item.description: The surging shares of CoreWeave Inc. and Palantir Technologies Inc. are drawing comparisons to meme stocks — whose rapid gains are fueled by retail trader fervor more than financial performance.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: CoreWeave Inc. signage in Times Square in New York, on May 9.

item.title: Cisco Updates Networking Products in Bid to Tap AI-Fueled Demand
item.description: With data-transfer bottlenecks threatening to slow AI systems, Cisco aims to speed things up
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Cisco is updating its networking and security lineup to capitalize on artificial intelligence spending.

item.title: Paramount Global to Cut 3.5% of US Workforce Due to Decline of Cable-TV Industry
item.description: Paramount Global plans to cut several hundred employees on Tuesday due to a continuing decline in the cable-TV industry and the broader economic landscape.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miller

media:content.media:description: The Paramount Global headquarters in New York, US, on Tuesday, Aug. 27, 2024. Producer David Ellison's Skydance Media is set to become the new owner of Paramount Global after Seagram Co. heir Edgar Bronfman Jr. dropped out, ending one of the industry's most dramatic acquisition contests.

item.title: ‘SmartLess’ Podcast Hosts Are Starting a Phone Company
item.description: Actors see opportunity in mobile service with lower data
item.dc:creator: Lucas Shaw

media:content.media:description: Jason Bateman, from left, Sean Hayes, and Will Arnett in Amagansett, New York in 2024 .

item.title: BP Puts AI at Heart of Efforts to Boost Performance
item.description: When engineers prepare to drill for oil, they know the spot deep underground where the well must end and can choose their starting point, but there are many possible routes in between.
item.dc:creator: Mitchell Ferman

media:content.media:description: BP's Center for High-Performance Computing.

item.title: Switch 2 Resellers Drive Thriving Market in Japan Despite Crackdown
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Mayumi Negishi reports on the backlash against scalpers who are finding ways to obtain and sell the new Switch 2 game console outside the authorized retail outlets.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Negishi

media:content.media:description: Customers use Nintendo Co. Switch 2 game consoles to play the Mario Kart World video game at a Bic Camera Inc. electronics store in Tokyo, Japan, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. Nintendo Co. fans from Tokyo to Manhattan stood in line for hours to be among the first to get a Switch 2, fueling one of the biggest global gadget debuts since the iPhone launches of yesteryear.

item.title: Tencent Music to Buy Ximalaya to Drive Online Media Ambitions
item.description: Tencent Music Entertainment Group has agreed to buy Chinese podcasting startup Ximalaya Inc. for $1.3 billion in cash plus an issuance of stock, a deal that propels its ambition to become China’s answer to Spotify.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Dong Cao

media:content.media:description: Tencent Music branding. Photographer: Spencer Platt/Getty Images

item.title: From Visas to Jets, US and China Are Finding New Trade Leverage
item.description: Donald Trump brought many of the same grievances to his second trade war against China, but the economic battleground that’s emerged since then is making it harder to avoid a rupture this time around.
item.dc:creator: James Mayger

item.title: Big Tech Drives Bullish Flows in US Stocks, Citi’s Montagu Says
item.description: US technology heavyweights have attracted a flurry of bullish bets as optimism around the economic outlook overshadows trade concerns, according to Citigroup Inc. strategists.
item.dc:creator: Sagarika Jaisinghani

item.title: Uber, SoftBank-Backed Wayve Plan Trial of Driverless Cars in UK
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. and self-driving technology firm Wayve Technologies Ltd. plan to run their first trial of fully autonomous vehicles in London, paving the way for the two companies to launch commercial robotaxi services in the UK and beyond.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Wayve has been testing its driver-assistance technology in the US, UK, Germany and Japan.

item.title: Czech Grocer Launches AI Delivery Platform to Rival Ocado
item.description: Czech online grocer Rohlik Group is spinning out its AI-driven platform for speedy grocery deliveries with worldwide ambitions, taking on the likes of Ocado Group Plc.
item.dc:creator: Katie Linsell

media:content.media:description: A Rohlik Group facility.

item.title: TSMC’s May Revenue Surges 40% in Sign of Resilient AI Demand
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., the main chipmaker for Nvidia Corp. and Apple Inc., reported a 40% jump in May revenue after companies stockpiled chips in response to mounting trade uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

item.title: Trump Says China ‘Not Easy’ as Trade Talks to Resume Tuesday
item.description: Trade talks between the US and China will continue into a second day, according to a US official, as the two sides look to ease tensions over shipments of technology and rare earth elements.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Flatley, Tyler Kendall

item.title: Huawei Founder Waves Off Chip Curbs as Trade Talks Proceed
item.description: Huawei Technologies Co. founder Ren Zhengfei dismissed the impact of US export restrictions on China in a front-page People’s Daily article, wading into one of the key topics dogging Washington-Beijing trade negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Edwin Chan, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: Ren Zhengfei, founder and chief executive officer of Huawei Technologies Co., poses for a photograph following a Bloomberg Television interview at the company's headquarters in Shenzhen, China, on Friday, May 24, 2019. Ren, the billionaire founder of China's largest technology company, conceded that Trump administration export curbs will narrow a two-year lead Huawei had painstakingly built over rivals like Ericsson AB and Nokia Oyj. But the company will either ramp up its own chip supply or find alternatives to keep its edge in smartphones and 5G. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg
